subject: Devo. for Apr. 2
verse: "If you prize wisdom, she will exalt you. Embrace her and she will honor you. " (Pro. 4:8)
reflection: We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings GREAT REWARDS. (Rev. 21:7)
prayer: I thank You Lord, for what Christ did for us on the cross and what really happened when He rose for the dead. What we need to remember is that He conquered the grave, death, and Satan. This victory can also be ours by believing, persevering, and remaining faithful to Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"If you prize wisdom, she will exalt you. Embrace her and she will

honor you." (Pro. 4:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining

faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings

GREAT REWARDS. (Rev. 21:7)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for what Christ did for us on the cross and what
really

happened when He rose for the dead. What we need to remember is that

He conquered the grave, death, and Satan. This victory can also be
ours

by believing, persevering, and remaining faithful to Christ. . .
Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 3
verse: "Do not do as the wicked do or follow the path of evildoers. Avoid their haunts, turn away and go somewhere else. (Pro. 4:13, 14)
reflection: While we should be accepting of others, we need a healthy skepticism about human behavior. When you feel yourself being heavily influenced proceed with caution. The oLD SAYING is: "do not do anything in the daytime, that will keep you awake at night.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would keep me on the straight and narrow, the path of Your will. AMEN.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Do not do as the wicked do or follow the path of evildoers._

_Avoid their haunts, turn away and go somewhere else._

(Pro. 4:13, 14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

While we should be accepting of others, we need a healthy

skepticism about human behavior. When you feel yourself

being heavily influenced proceed with caution. The oLD

SAYING is: "do not do anything in the daytime, that will

keep you awake at night.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would

keep me on the straight and narrow, the path of Your will.

AMEN.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 4
verse: "The way of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, which shines ever brighter until full light of day. " (Pro. 4:18)
reflection: The wicked are NOT so, the wicked are like the darkest night. The righteous follow the light of God's Word. and they allow God's Word to penetrate deep into their heart.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance, so that Your holy Word would enlighten my every thought. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The way of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn,_

_which shines ever brighter until full light of day." _(Pro.4:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The wicked are NOT so, the wicked are like the darkest night.

The righteous follow the light of God's Word. and they allow

God's Word to penetrate deep into their heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance,

so that Your holy Word would enlighten my every thought.

Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 5
verse: "Above all else, guard your heart, for it affects everything you do. Avoid all perverse talk; stay far from corrupt speech. " (Pro. 4:23, 24)
reflection: Jesus reminds us in Luke 6:45 THAT our speech and actions reveals the true underlying beliefs, attitudes, and motivations. The good impressions we try to make cannot last IF our heart is deceptive. What is in our heart will come out in our speech and behavior.
prayer: O Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that You will forgive me when my speech and attitude are not pleasing to You. I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Above all else, guard your heart, for it affects everything you
do._

_Avoid all perverse talk; stay far from corrupt speech." _(Pro. 4:23,
24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus reminds us in Luke 6:45 THAT our speech and actions reveals

the true underlying beliefs, attitudes, and motivations. The good

impressions we try to make cannot last IF our heart is deceptive.

What is in our heart will come out in our speech and behavior.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that You will forgive me when

my speech and attitude are not pleasing to You. I pray that I would

be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 6
verse: "Evil people CANNOT sleep until they have done their evil deed for the day. They CANNOT rest unless they have caused someone to stumble. " (Pro. 4:16)
reflection: A person's thoughts and plans reflect his or her character. What do you think about as you lie down to sleep? Do your desires involve greed or steeping on others to achieve your goals? Evil thoughts lead to evil actions.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me for any evil thoughts. I pray that You would cleanse me of any further evil thoughts. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Evil people CANNOT sleep until they have done their evil _

_deed for the day. They CANNOT rest unless they have caused_

_someone to stumble." _(Pro. 4:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A person's thoughts and plans reflect his or her character.

What do you think about as you lie down to sleep? Do

your desires involve greed or steeping on others to

achieve your goals? Evil thoughts lead to evil actions.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me for

any evil thoughts. I pray that You would cleanse me of any

further evil thoughts. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 7
verse: "Mark out a straight path for your feet, then stick to the path and stay safe. Don 't get side tracked, keep your feet from following evil. (Pro. 4:26, 27)
reflection: What is being implied is that we should put boundaries on our desires. We should not go after everything we see. We need to keep our eyes fixed on our goal, and not get side tracked on detours that lead to sin.
prayer: Dear Lord I pray that I will always remain sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance so that I would not go the way of the world. I pray that my goal will always be to keep my eyes fixed on You. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Mark out a straight path for your feet, then stick to the path and
_

_stay safe. Don 't get side tracked, keep your feet from following
evil. _

(Pro. 4:26, 27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What is being implied is that we should put boundaries on our
desires.

We should not go after everything we see. We need to keep our eyes

fixed on our goal, and not get side tracked on detours that lead to
sin.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I pray that I will always remain sensitive to Your Holy

Spirit's guidance so that I would not go the way of the world. I

pray that my goal will always be to keep my eyes fixed on You.

Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 8
verse: "Pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my wise counsel. Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge. " (Pro. 5:1, 2)
reflection: We need to remember that sin offends our Holy God, and separates us from Him. Because God is Holy, He cannot ignore, excuse, or tolerate sin, as though it did not matter. Sin cuts people off from Him. This why we need to study God's wisdom and wise counsel; (the Bible).
prayer: O Lord of all knowledge, wisdom, and wise counsel, I pray that I will never grow tired of studying Your Holy Word so that I grow in knowledge in accordance with Your will. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my wise counsel._

_Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge."_

(Pro. 5:1, 2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to remember that sin offends our Holy God, and separates

us from Him. Because God is Holy, He cannot ignore, excuse, or

tolerate sin, as though it did not matter. Sin cuts people off from

Him. This why we need to study God's wisdom and wise counsel; (the
Bible).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of all knowledge, wisdom, and wise counsel, I pray that I

will never grow tired of studying Your Holy Word so that I grow

in knowledge in accordance with Your will. . . Amen.

_ _

subject: Devo. for Apr. 9
verse: "The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey and her mouth is smoother then oil. But the result is as bitter as poison. " (Pro. 5:3, 4a)
reflection: The writer of proverbs is talking about a prostitute, and is warning against illicit sex for several reasons. (first) A prostitute's charm is used as an example of any temptation to do wrong and leave the pursuit of wisdom. (second) Sexual immorality of any kind was and still is extremely dangerous. (third) Sexual immorality is against God's law.
prayer: I pray for Your Holy Spirit's continual guidance in my life so that I would not stray from Your law. My prayer is that I would always remain faithful to You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey and her _

_mouth is smoother then oil. But the result is as bitter as poison."_

(Pro. 5:3, 4a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The writer of proverbs is talking about a prostitute, and is warning

against illicit sex for several reasons. (first) A prostitute's charm
is

used as an example of any temptation to do wrong and leave the

pursuit of wisdom. (second) Sexual immorality of any kind was

and still is extremely dangerous. (third) Sexual immorality is

against God's law.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I pray for Your Holy Spirit's continual guidance in my life so that

I would not stray from Your law. My prayer is that I would always

remain faithful to You. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 10
verse: "If you have co-signed a loan for a friend or guaranteed a debt of someone you hardly know, if you have trapped yourself and are caught by what you said, quick, get out of it if you possibly can! You have placed yourself at your friend's mercy. (Pro. 6:1, 3a)
reflection: These verses are not a plea against generosity, but against overextending one's financial resources, which could lead to your own poverty. It is important to maintain a balance between generosity and good stewardship. God wants us to help our friends and the needy, but He does not promise to cover the costs of every unwise commitment we make.
prayer: Dear Lord I thank You for the wise counsel of these verses, may I always be prudent and follow Your counsel. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If you have co-signed a loan for a friend or guaranteed a debt _

_of someone you hardly know, if you have trapped yourself and _

_are caught by what you said, quick, get out of it if you possibly _

_can! You have placed yourself at your friend's mercy. _(Pro. 6:1,
3a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verses are not a plea against generosity, but against overextending one's financial resources, which could lead to your own

poverty. It is important to maintain a balance between generosity

and good stewardship. God wants us to help our friends and the

needy, but He does not promise to cover the costs of every unwise

commitment we make.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I thank You for the wise counsel of these verses, may

I always be prudent and follow Your counsel. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 11
verse: "A LITTLE SLEEP, a LITTLE SLUMBER, and a LITTLE FOLDING of hands to rest, and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want like an armed man. " (Pro. 6:10, 11)
reflection: A little, laziness works in small increments, in lame excuses that seek present comforts at the risk of future poverty.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would not look for excuses to avoid having to do the tasks at hand, hopping that someone else will do the work I should be doing. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A LITTLE SLEEP, a LITTLE SLUMBER, and a LITTLE FOLDING of hands_

_to rest, and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and_

_want like an armed man." _(Pro. 6:10, 11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A little, laziness works in small increments, in lame excuses

that seek present comforts at the risk of future poverty.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would not look for excuses to avoid

having to do the tasks at hand, hopping that someone else

will do the work I should be doing. . . Amen.

subject: Devo for Apr. 12
verse: "A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech, therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly, in a moment he will be broken beyond healing. " (Pro. 6:12, 15)
reflection: Solomon labels the deceptive person as one who is good for nothing and whose mouth is corrupt. The corrupt speech here could include slander gossip, misrepresentation, or schemes that call for fast talk with skilled deception. We should never play the role of a judge, we need to leave that role up to God.
prayer: Dear Lord, I seek Your forgiveness, because it seems to be easy to talk about other people in our conversations, which is less then complementary. Help me to leave the role of judging up to You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech,_

_therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly, in a moment he will_

_be broken beyond healing." _(Pro. 6:12, 15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon labels the deceptive person as one who is good for nothing

and whose mouth is corrupt. The corrupt speech here could include

slander gossip, misrepresentation, or schemes that call for fast talk

with skilled deception. We should never play the role of a judge, we

need to leave that role up to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I seek Your forgiveness, because it seems to be easy to

talk about other people in our conversations, which is less then

complementary. Help me to leave the role of judging up to You. . .
Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 13
verse: "There are six things the Lord hates, no seven things He detests. haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent, and that plots evil, feet that race to do wrong, a false witness who pours out lies, a person who sows discord among brothers. " (Pro. 6:16-19)
reflection: We need to note that the sin of murder is listed with other sins more subtle and are hard to prove and punish. But we really need to remember God hate all sin, even the ones missed or camouflaged by humans. Another fact to remember is God sees into the heart.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I am so thankful that even-though You hate all sin, if we come to You in sincere repentance You will forgive us. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"There are six things the Lord hates, no seven things He detests._

_haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent, and_

_that plots evil, feet that race to do wrong, a false witness who_

_pours out lies, a person who sows discord among brothers."_

(Pro. 6:16-19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to note that the sin of murder is listed with other sins

more subtle and are hard to prove and punish. But we really

need to remember God hate all sin, even the ones missed or

camouflaged by humans. Another fact to remember is God

sees into the heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I am so thankful that even-though

You hate all sin, if we come to You in sincere repentance

You will forgive us. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 14
verse: "My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with in you; keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple of your eye. " (Pro. 7:1, 2)
reflection: Keeping God's law is not mere obedience to external commands, it is a matter of the heart. When we store God's Words within us, God keeps us from sinning. Life at its fullest comes to those who fear, love, and trust in God and His commands and promises.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance so that I would store up Your Word within my heart. Forgive me when I stray from Your Word I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with in_

_you; keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple _

_of your eye." _(Pro. 7:1, 2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Keeping God's law is not mere obedience to external commands,

it is a matter of the heart. When we store God's Words within us,

God keeps us from sinning. Life at its fullest comes to those who

fear, love, and trust in God and His commands and promises.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance

so that I would store up Your Word within my heart. Forgive me

when I stray from Your Word I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 15
verse: "Say to wisdom, "You are my sister, " and call insight your intimate friend, to keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words. " (Pro. 7:4, 5)
reflection: Once again, wisdom is contrasted with the adulteress. When we keep intimate company with God's wisdom, we will be kept from adultery and the other sins of the world.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would never stray from Your wisdom, that can be found in Your Word. Continue to place a hunger in my heart for Your Word. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and call insight your intimate_

_friend, to keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress_

_with her smooth words." _(Pro. 7:4, 5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Once again, wisdom is contrasted with the adulteress. When we keep

intimate company with God's wisdom, we will be kept from adultery

and the other sins of the world.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would never stray from Your wisdom, that

can be found in Your Word. Continue to place a hunger in my heart

for Your Word. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 16
verse: "Listen to me! For I have excellent things to tell you. Everything I say is right. For I speak the truth and hate every kind of deception. (Pro. 8:6, 7)
reflection: The strategy for effective living--Begins with--Wisdom from God. It requires--Moral living--Trusting in God and His Word. It also requires--Practical application--Acting on God's direction in daily devotion. Resulting in--Effective living--Experiencing what God does with our obedience.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would gain a greater wisdom through trusting in Your Word. I pray that I would experience Your presences in my daily life. . . AMEN.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Listen to me! For I have excellent things to tell you. Everything I
say _

_is right. For I speak the truth and hate every kind of deception.
_(Pro. 8:6, 7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The strategy for effective living--Begins with--Wisdom from God.

It requires--Moral living--Trusting in God and His Word.

It also requires--Practical application--Acting on God's direction in
daily devotion.

Resulting in--Effective living--Experiencing what God does with our
obedience.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would gain a greater wisdom
through

trusting in Your Word. I pray that I would experience Your presences
in

my daily life. . . AMEN.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 17
verse: "All who fear the Lord will hate evil, That is why I hate pride, arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech. " (Pro. 8:13)
reflection: The more people fear and respect God, the more he or she will hate evil. Love for God and love for sin cannot coexist. Harboring secret sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself. Make a clean break with sin and commit yourself completely to God.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would instill in me godly judgment, each day so that I would not sin against You. I pray for godly discernment. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"All who fear the Lord will hate evil, That is why I hate pride,_

_arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech." _(Pro. 8:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The more people fear and respect God, the more he or she will hate

evil. Love for God and love for sin cannot coexist. Harboring secret

sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself. Make a clean

break with sin and commit yourself completely to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would instill in me godly

judgment, each day so that I would not sin against You. I pray for

godly discernment. . .Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 18
verse: "By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just; rulers lead with my help, and nobles, make righteous judgments. " (Pro. 8:15, 16)
reflection: Kings--rulers--princes--nobles. Wisdom is a crucial asset for those who govern. Their JUST government evidences the wisdom of God, who sets governments in place and uses them for His purpose. Let us remember to pray for our government officials federal state and local, that they would seek Godly wisdom.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that each of our government officials, including our president, would seek Godly wisdom, and would spend less time at name calling, and get on with the business at hand. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just; rulers lead with
_

_my help, and nobles, make righteous judgments." _(Pro. 8:15, 16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Kings--rulers--princes--nobles. Wisdom is a crucial asset for those

who govern. Their JUST government evidences the wisdom of God,

who sets governments in place and uses them for His purpose.

Let us remember to pray for our government officials federal state

and local, that they would seek Godly wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that each of our government officials, including

our president, would seek Godly wisdom, and would spend less

time at name calling, and get on with the business at hand. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 19
verse: I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently will find me. " (Pro. 8:17)
reflection: "I love those who love me. " Wisdom is set into the context of an intimate relationship. The verses second line adds to the thought of the first, promising that those who love and seek Wisdom will find her. Seek. . . Find. Are words used often in Proverbs for the quest of wisdom.
prayer: Dear Lord, once again I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance, I pray that I would be obedient in following His leading so that I will grow in wisdom. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently _

_will find me." _(Pro. 8:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"I love those who love me." _Wisdom is set into the context of an

intimate relationship. The verses second line adds to the thought

of the first, promising that those who love and seek Wisdom will

find her. _Seek_. . ._ Find._ Are words used often in Proverbs for
the

quest of wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, once again I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance, I

pray that I would be obedient in following His leading so that I

will grow in wisdom. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 20
verse: "Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold, and my yield than choice silver. " (Pro. 8:18, 19)
reflection: "Enduring wealth. . . fruit. . . yield. This agricultural language accents Wisdom as a renewing resource, promising future blessings, in contrast with the stagnant wealth of precious metals and gems.
prayer: Dear Lord, as I grow older I thank you for the promise of a place where there will be no more pain or sorrow for those who trust and believe in You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and_

_righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, even fine_

_gold, and my yield than choice silver." _(Pro. 8:18, 19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Enduring wealth. . . fruit. . . yield. _This agricultural language

accents Wisdom as a renewing resource, promising future

blessings, in contrast with the stagnant wealth of precious

metals and gems.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, as I grow older I thank you for the promise of

a place where there will be no more pain or sorrow for those

who trust and believe in You. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 21:
verse: "I walk in the way of the righteous, in the paths of justice, granting an inheritance to those who love Me, and filling their treasuries. " (Pro. 8:20, 21)
reflection: "Way (s) Used for a "pattern of behavior or custom. " "The way of the Lord" is twofold: He punishes sinfulness, but He also show mercy to the repentant. Jesus describes Himself as the "way" in (Jn. 14:6). "Granting an inheritance to those who love Me. " This is the riches that come to those who follow God's Wisdom, the Christ, are celebrated in several NT passages. Paul speaks of the rich inheritance of those who are in Christ (Eph. 13:14)
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the riches that come to all who except Christ as their Lord and Savior. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I walk in the way of the righteous, in the paths of justice,
granting_

_an inheritance to those who love Me, and filling their treasuries."_

(Pro. 8:20, 21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"_Way (s) _Used for a "_pattern of behavior or custom." "The way of
the_

_Lord" _is twofold: He punishes sinfulness, but He also show mercy to

the repentant. Jesus describes Himself as the "_way" _in (Jn. 14:6).

_"Granting_ _an inheritance to those who love Me." _This is the
riches that

come to those who follow God's Wisdom, the Christ, are celebrated in

several NT passages. Paul speaks of the rich inheritance of those who

are in Christ (Eph. 13:14)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for the riches that come to all who except
Christ

as their Lord and Savior. . . Amen

subject: Devo. for Apr. 22
verse: "The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His work, the first of His acts of old. " (Pro. 8:22)
reflection: Just as Solomon's students were encouraged to acquire or posses Wisdom, so the Lord possess Wisdom in eternity, EVEN before His act of creation.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I plead again for greater sensitivity to attain godly wisdom, I pray this in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His work, _

_the first of His acts of old." _(Pro. 8:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Just as Solomon's students were encouraged to acquire

or posses Wisdom, so the Lord possess Wisdom in eternity,

EVEN before His act of creation.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I plead again for greater sensitivity

to attain godly wisdom, I pray this in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 23
verse: "Ages ago I was set up, at the first, before the beginning of the earth. (Pro. 8:23)
reflection: The words, set up, here is referring to Wisdom begotten of God. For Christ as appointed Messiah BEFORE the creation of the world. In (Jn. 17:5) Jesus refers to this statement when He says: "Now, Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began. " Before Jesus came to earth, He was ONE with God. At this point Jesus was asking His Father, to restore Him to His original place of honor.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for coming to earth and taking the punishment I deserved for my sins. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Ages ago I was set up, at the first, before the beginning of the
earth._

(Pro. 8:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The words, _set up, here is referring to Wisdom begotten of God._

For Christ as appointed Messiah BEFORE_ _the_ _creation of the world.

In (Jn. 17:5) Jesus refers to this statement when He says: "_Now, _

_Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began_."

Before Jesus came to earth, He was ONE with God. At this point

Jesus was asking His Father, to restore Him to His original place

of honor.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for coming to earth and taking

the punishment I deserved for my sins. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 24
verse: "When there were no depths I was brought forth, When there were no springs abounding with water. " (Pro. 8:24)
reflection: This anticipates the N. T. language describing Jesus a "begotten" the eternal generation of the Son from the Father, before time and space were created. We need to also understand Wisdom to be eternal, its clearly not a part of creation. . .
prayer: Thank You Lord Jesus, for coming to earth to show us the way to eternal life and to pay the price for our sins. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When there were no depths I was brought forth,_

_When there were no springs abounding with water."_

(Pro. 8:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This anticipates the N.T. language describing Jesus a "begotten" the

eternal generation of the Son from the Father, before time and space

were created. We need to also understand Wisdom to be eternal, its

clearly not a part of creation. . .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord Jesus, for coming to earth to show us the way to

eternal life and to pay the price for our sins. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 25
verse: "When He established the heavens, when He made3 firm the skies, When He assigned to the sea its limit, then I was beside Him like a master workman. " (Pro. 8:27a, 28a, 29a, 30a)
reflection: It is often said that the O T is revealed in the N T while the N T is concealed in the OT in other words, what is not entirely clear in the O T becomes clear in the coming of Jesus the Christ. That is what has happened in Pro. 8. The NT explicitly states that Jesus is the one "In whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. (Col. 2:3)
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that as I read Proverbs, I will hear the voice of the Redeemer. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When He established the heavens, when He made3 firm the skies,_

_When He assigned to the sea its limit, then I was beside Him like_

_a master workman." _(Pro. 8:27a, 28a, 29a, 30a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is often said that the O T is revealed in the N T while the N T

is concealed in the OT in other words, what is not entirely clear in

the O T becomes clear in the coming of Jesus the Christ. That is what

has happened in Pro. 8. The NT explicitly states that Jesus is the
one

"In whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. (Col.
2:3)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that as I read Proverbs, I will hear the voice of
the

Redeemer. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 26
verse: "Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting beside my doors. " (Pro. 8:34)
reflection: The Lord is our Wisdom. Like Wisdom in ch. 8, Christ calls us from worldly foolishness, judgments, and death, TO obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. Christ's eternal nature, His relationship with the Father, and His work in creation all mark Him as the very wisdom of God.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would continue to draw closer to You so that I would grow in obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my_

_gates, waiting beside my doors." _(Pro. 8:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Lord is our Wisdom. Like Wisdom in ch. 8, Christ calls us from

worldly foolishness, judgments, and death, TO obedience, God's favor,

and abundant life. Christ's eternal nature, His relationship with the

Father, and His work in creation all mark Him as the very wisdom of

God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would continue to draw closer to You so that

I would grow in obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 27
verse: "Leave your simple ways, and live, and walk in the way of insight. " (Pro. 9:6)
reflection: live Wisdom promises life to all who share her feast, which gives life (8:35). the way of Wisdom leads to abundant life. (Wisdom be the way of Christ)
prayer: I thank You Lord Jesus that You have made the way which leads to abundant life----(eternal life). . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"_Leave your simple ways, and live, and walk in the way of

insight." (Pro. 9:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_live _Wisdom promises life to all who share her feast, which

gives life (8:35). the way of Wisdom leads to abundant life.

(Wisdom be the way of Christ)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord Jesus that You have made the way which

leads to abundant life----(eternal life). . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 28
verse: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight." (Pro. 9:10)
reflection: "Fear of the Lord. . . and knowledge" Leads to a sense of sin, which leads to repentance, and thus God bestows His compassion upon those who are penitent.
prayer: My prayer again today O Lord, is to seek forgiveness for my every sin. I also pray for the leadership of our country, both federal, state, and local, that they would seek godly wisdom in governing this country in accordance with Your will. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the_

_knowledge of the Holy One is insight." _(Pro. 9:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"_Fear of the Lord. . .and knowledge"_ Leads to a sense of

sin, which leads to repentance, and thus God bestows His

compassion upon those who are penitent.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

My prayer again today O Lord, is to seek forgiveness for my

every sin. I also pray for the leadership of our country, both

federal, state, and local, that they would seek godly wisdom

in governing this country in accordance with Your will. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 29
verse: "For by Me your days will be multiplied, and years will added to your life, If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you scoff, you alone will bear it. " (9:11, 12)
reflection: As we saw in 3:1, 2 those who live by Wisdom will be blest with long life. God gives wisdom, and the wise are blessed. Those who reject Wisdom's invitation have no one to blame but themselves for the sad plight of their lives. The wise receive grace's gift, deliverance from the way of death. Those on their way with Folly will get what they deserve and bear it all alone.
prayer: Dear Lord save me when I stray from You. Make me wise to the truth of Your love. Help me to know you and love You so deeply that in your life-giving presence I will grow more like You. I pray this in Your Holy and Precious name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"For by Me your days will be multiplied, and years will added to
your_

_life, If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you scoff, you
alone_

_will bear it." _(9:11, 12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As we saw in 3:1, 2 those who live by Wisdom will be blest with long

life. God gives wisdom, and the wise are blessed. Those who reject

Wisdom's invitation have no one to blame but themselves for the sad

plight of their lives. The wise receive grace's gift, deliverance
from the

way of death. Those on their way with Folly will get what they
deserve

and bear it all alone.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord save me when I stray from You. Make me wise to the truth

of Your love. Help me to know you and love You so deeply that in your

life-giving presence I will grow more like You. I pray this in Your
Holy

and Precious name. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for Apr. 30
verse: "A wise son makes his father glad, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother. " (Pro. 10:1)
reflection: Many proverbs connect a son's behavior or character with the well being of his parents. The good works of Jesus' followers likewise reflect the glory of their heavenly Father. The question we need to ask ourselves is, "What does my character reflect?"
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my behavior would always reflect the glory of my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A wise son makes his father glad, but a foolish son is a_

_sorrow to his mother." _(Pro. 10:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many proverbs connect a son's behavior or character with the

well being of his parents. The good works of Jesus' followers

likewise reflect the glory of their heavenly Father. The question

we need to ask ourselves is, "What does my character reflect?"

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my behavior would always

reflect the glory of my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: Devo. for May 1
verse: "Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living can save your life. " (Pro. 10:2)
reflection: Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by choosing ill-gotten gain. For example, craving satisfaction, they may do something that destroys their chances of ever achieving happiness. God's principles for right living bring lasting happiness, because they guide us into long-term right behavior in spite of our ever changing feelings.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray for Your guiding principles for right-living which will guide me into a long-term right behavior onto a living relationship with Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living can_

_save your life." _(Pro. 10:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by choosing

ill-gotten gain. For example, craving satisfaction, they may

do something that destroys their chances of ever achieving

happiness. God's principles for right living bring lasting

happiness, because they guide us into long-term right

behavior in spite of our ever changing feelings.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray for Your guiding principles

for right-living which will guide me into a long-term

right behavior onto a living relationship with Jesus Christ.

Amen.
